step1.sentence: I took a quick cat nap on the couch before heading out to dinner.

step2.story: After pulling an all-nighter to finish her report, Maya could barely keep her eyes open at work. She slipped into the break room during lunch and took a twenty-minute cat nap on the sofa. When she woke up, she felt surprisingly refreshed and powered through the rest of the afternoon.

step3.story: Daniel had been driving for six hours straight on the highway, and the afternoon sun was making his eyelids dangerously heavy. He spotted a rest area sign and decided to pull over before he became a hazard on the road. He reclined his seat, set a fifteen-minute alarm on his phone, and drifted off into a cat nap with the windows cracked open. The gentle breeze and distant hum of passing trucks formed a strange lullaby. When the alarm buzzed, he stretched his arms and blinked a few times. That short cat nap was all he needed — the remaining three hours of driving felt effortless.

meaning.realUsageKo: 짧은 시간 동안 가볍게 자는 낮잠을 가리킬 때 사용합니다. 보통 15~30분 정도의 토막 잠을 뜻하며, 일상 대화에서 편하게 쓰입니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 고양이가 하루 종일 짧게 자고 깨기를 반복하는 습성에서 유래한 표현입니다. 18세기경부터 영어에서 사용되기 시작했습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 가벼운 구어체 표현으로, 격식 없는 일상 대화에서 주로 쓰입니다. 부정적인 뉘앙스 없이 누구나 편하게 사용할 수 있습니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: I'm going to take a cat nap before the meeting starts.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 회의 시작 전에 짧은 낮잠을 잘 거예요.
